scenario:
S&P Global, American Express, and Nu Holdings are recommended as long-term investments due to their resilience in the face of macro headwinds. The Federal Reserve's interest rate cuts in 2024 and expected further cuts in 2025 could stabilize the financial sector. 

S&P Global provides financial data, credit rating, and analytics services to Fortune 100 and 500 companies. Its revenue grew at a 16% compound annual growth rate (CAGR) from 2019 to 2024, and analysts expect 7% CAGR in revenue and 14% in earnings per share (EPS) from 2024 to 2027. The stock trades at 38 times this year's earnings.

American Express controls a smaller card processing market share but has a business model that insulates it from economic downturns. Its revenue and EPS grew at a 10% and 12% CAGR from 2019 to 2024, and analysts expect 8% and 12% CAGR from 2024 to 2027. The stock trades at 19 times this year's earnings.

Nu Holdings is the largest digital-only direct bank in Latin America, with a customer base that more than tripled from 2021 to 2024. Its revenue grew at a 89% CAGR from 2021 to 2024, and analysts expect 29% CAGR in revenue and 38% in EPS from 2024 to 2026. The stock trades at 21 times this year's earnings.
